D. addressed the Pharisees who had asked Him

33. According to Matthew, the inscription over Jesus when 
he was crucified was 
A. “This is the King of the Jews” 
B. “The king of the Jews” 
C. “Jesus of Nazareth, the king of the Jews” 
D. “This is Jesus king of the Jews”. 
 
34. Which disciple asked Jesus, “Lord, we do not know 
where you are going; how can we know the way?” 
A. Peter B.  James C. Thomas D. John. 
 
35. “... For he was numbered among us, and was alloted his 
share in this ministry...” 
What hapen to the person referred to in the statement 
above? 
A. He was crucified 
B. He committed suicide 
C. He abandoned the ministry 
D. He was taken into heaven 
 
36. The disciples in the early church chose the seven 
deacons inorder to 
A. solve the problem of murmuring by the 
Hellenites 
B. have adequate daily distribution of food 
C. take proper care of the neglected widows 
D. devote themselves to prayer and teaching the 
world. 
 
37. The sound which came from heaven on the day of 
Pentecost is likened to that of 
A. a mighty wind B. a surging ocean 
C. cracking flames    D. heavy thunder 
 
38. What were the major issues of controversy that led to 
the appearance of Paul and Barnabas before the Council 
in Jerusalem? 
A. Circumcision and food offered to idols 
B. Unchastity and the Law of Moses 
C. Circumcision and the Law of Moses 
D. The Law of Moses and Pollution by idols. 
 
39. According to John, the distinctive quality of the 
disciples of Jesus Christ is 
A. preaching the word of God 
B. witnessing to unbelievers 
C. laying down their lives for others 
D. showing love to one another. 
 
40. God has extended the promise He made to Abraham to 
all those who share his faith based on 
A. righteousness of faith 
B. observance of the law 
C. the grace of God 
D. decent from Abraham. 
 
41. According to Galatians, what makes all believers sons 
of God is 
A. the law   B. faith in Christ Jesus 
C. faith in God D. righteousness  of 
God. 
 
42. Speaking in tongue according to Paul, is where 
A. there is one with the gift of interpretation 
B. the Holy Spirit is present during worship 
C. there are apostles and evangelists 
D. those speaking in tongues are many. 
 
43. Paul says that anyone who does acts of mercy should 
do so with 
A. zeal B. liberality C. faith D. cheerfulness. 
 
44. Paul advises Christians to obey authorities because; 
A. it could lead to salvation 
B. rulers want people to obey them 
C. they have divine mandate 
D. they are God’s children. 
 
45. The second coming of Christ shall be recognized by: 
A. His arrival in Jerusalem 
B. a cry of command 
C. earthquakes and wars, darkness on earth 
D. darkness on earth. 
 
46. “And the dead in Christ will rise first; then we who are 
alive, who are left, shall be caught up together with 
them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air” 
From the statement above, Paul’s belief was that he 
would; 
A. live to witness the second coming of Christ 
B. have died before the second coming of Christ 
C. resurrect at the second coming of Christ 
D. have been in paradise before the second 
coming. 
 
47. According to James, whoever keeps the whole law but 
fails in one point 
A. will be forgiven in heaven 
B. has become guilty of all of it 
C. will be punished for a little while 
D. must asks for forgiveness. 
 
48. James in his Epistle urged the brethren to count their 
trials as joy because the testing of their faith produces; 
A. joy B. wisdom C. righteousness 
D. steadfastness. 
 
49. According to Peter, if a Christian suffers for his faith, 
he should not be 
A. ashamed B. worried C. blamed D. afraid. 
 
50. Peter says that Chrisitan would put to silence the 
ignorance of foolish men by 
A. preaching the resurrection 
B. being humble 
C. doing right 
D. praying daily.
